pullRequest.title: Fix #5840: PanelGrid Support row and column on responsive
pullRequest.bodyText:
Responsive panelgrid does not currently allow specific cells within the grid to be identified or styled uniquely.  This capability only exists with the layout='tabular' mode.
This pull requests now enables row and column components to be used with layout='grid' and column components to be used with layout='flex'.
The usefulness of this can be seen in the context of legacy tabular mode which allowed for rows to be highlighted differently based on odd or even colors.  In the context of responsive design there is still a need to control the styling of rows and cells within the grid and this pull request enables that.

 ```
 
+## Responsive Style, StyleClass, and ID
+PanelGrid offers responsive support using `layout="flex"` for PrimeFlex or `layout="grid"` for Grid CSS and
+ a non-responsive layout using `layout="tabular"`. Flex and Grid layout wraps components in a DIV and grid layout
+ further wraps a row in a DIV.  These DIVs may now be styled by utilizing `row` and `column` components which optionally
+ represent the cell and may be utilized to attach `style`, `styleClass` and `id`.
+
+`layout="grid"` supports `column` and `row`.
+`layout="flex"` supports `column`.
+
+`row` may contain individual components, or additional `column` cells, within the grid responsive layout.
+The respective cell style will be utilized from the provided `columnClasses` and from any `styleClass` on the
+component.  If more components are contained within the row component then the respective `columnClasses` will
+be utilized based `columnClasses[column%columns]`.
+
+
+```xml
+<p:panelGrid 
+        columns="2" 
+        layout="grid"
+        columnClasses="ui-grid-col-8,ui-grid-col-4,ui-grid-col-8,ui-grid-col-4">

commit.message: Put back a documentation file accidentally removed.  This is at the state prior to implementing row and column responsive support for style, styleClass, and id, which can only be found in version 9.
Rows component with more columns than specified in the panelgrid tag will use all columnClasses specified.  class = columnClasses[index%columnClasses.length].
p:row can be added at any position in the grid and must result in the clean closure of prior row div and opening of a new row div.
